title: Asking Riot: Is saying "Ez" really a big deal or reportable offence?
body: Just wondering cause I'm holding the stance of no simply due to the presence of the mute button. But my friend says yes because he said only fa**ots say EZ

replies.body:
Hey man,

You might find this useful 

> **What's the behaviour team's standpoint on "GG EZ" being used? Is it seen as a reportable offense or is it not negative enough?**
> One of our philosophies is to try to not dictate what's OK or not OK in League of Legends unless we absolutely have to. We rely on data like Reports, Honors, social media, the Instant Feedback System and Tribunal to help determine the standards of what the community believes is OK or not OK. This is why all of our systems are intentionally designed to be community-driven, because we want players to have the ability to invest in and shape their own community. In saying this, looking at the data, "GGEZ" is considered a negative term, and is reportable. Players generally agree that the phrase is rarely used in a positive context, and is a pretty sour way to end a match.
-Riot Lyte

You can check out more questions and answers from Riot Lyte here - https://ask.fm/RiotLyte (hes been super busy working on Dynamic queue and new Champion Select so hasn't been as active recently)
Seems a bit much. I don't say it myself and it does make the person who said it come off as a colossal ball bag but it is hardly in the same category as hate speech or racism.

No one is saying its the same as hate speech or racism.

Its more like unsportsmanlike conduct.

oh no I wasnt suggesting that they were the same, but that I leave reporting verbal to the more unsavoury stuff (like racism, abuse, hate speech etc). Unsportsman maybe, but I use reports for the sort of conduct of someone who intentionally screws the team (stealing jg from jungler, refusing to engage in team fights, power farming lane, blaming team for their own failure etc).

To me someone saying GGEZ is just them being a cocky twat and no real harm done. And I quite like it when cocky twats have to eat their words after I wipe the floor of the rift with them.

GGEZ to me is just bad mannered sledging / banter.

But I can see how you think it could be taken as unsportsman like conduct given it is not very humble in victory.

Yeah it's fine that you think its alright. There's no problem with that. I was just answering his question =)

I'm just saying a majority of our playerbase feels its a pretty dick move and do report for it.
can definitely agree that it is a dick move - of that we have complete alignment :P

My take is it pretty much depends on context. If they mean no harm (or hell if they lose the game :P) or if it's all they've said all game then whatever, it's not really worth the report. But if they've been kind of iffy otherwise, not necessarily toxic, but not exactly a shining example of humanity either, then the 'ez' tends to be the decider for if I report them or not. 

I also have friends who say it from time to time, and to them it's all fun and games, it's just a joke to them, but when you consider the enemies' perspective, it kinda seems like a d*ck move. My opinion is don't say unless it's REALLY obvious it's a joke (like if you lose) because it might just be that last little annoyance that tilts someone something fierce and gets you an angry essay report :)

I guess some people crumble under pressure easier and the whole report over "gg ez" is just an easy way for them to vent some frustrations.
Its like when people slam others for feeding/playing poorly in blinds/aram, it doesn't really matter to me, its just a blind. A blind for me is a game to muck around and try to expand my champion pool, push the limits of champions well past what I would try in a real ranked match.
